page.title: 08Farming on Lundy.
page.content: Lundy is like one big farm-with the best of the grazing land in the south. The livestock are: 350-400 ewes,20-30 rams and 400-500 lambs;38 beef cattle and one dairy cow;6 ponies,5 foals and a stallion(recenly brought from the mainland).Some of the people that live on the island have their own goats and chickens.There are also deer and Soay sheep which roam wild and are culled occasionally to keep numbers down. Last year they started to put up electric fences to protect the stone walls -eventually they will have 20 miles of electric fencing. There are 4 tractors,a Land Rover and a bulldozer,but these are not only used for farming.There is also a horse drawn cart. Recently the farm buildings and facilities have been much improved but the farm only aims to break even. {Matthew Jones.
